sources.title: The Effectiveness of Online Dispute Resolution in Consumer Cases
key_findings: Online dispute resolution (ODR) platforms have been found to be effective in resolving consumer disputes, with a resolution rate of over 70%.
ODR platforms are particularly effective in cross-border disputes, where traditional mediation methods can be costly and time-consuming.
sources.usage_note: This study supports the efficacy of digital mediation in resolving disputes, which is a key component of the HappyNest business model.

sources.title: Online Dispute Resolution: The Future of Justice
key_findings: The use of online dispute resolution (ODR) platforms in the EU has increased by 50% in the past five years.
Consumers report high levels of satisfaction with ODR platforms, with 80% saying they would use such a platform again.
sources.usage_note: This data indicates a growing acceptance and satisfaction with digital mediation platforms among consumers in the EU, which bodes well for the HappyNest business model.

assumptions: The sources assume that the trends and findings will continue in the future.
